gao.dbmanager

Class Search<T extends IGeoObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gao.dbmanager.Search<T>

  • public final class Search<T extends IGeoObject>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to search for IGeoObjects.

    Key features:
    • spatial Index
    • database cursor
    • multithreading
    • internal minimal bounding rectangle check
    • exact query geometry
    • area constraint
    • maximum stored index
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Marcus Kerschner

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancel()
      Aborts a query that is already being executed (may not be supported by the JDBC driver).

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Determines if there are more rows to retrieve (either sure or maybe candidates).
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one more row to retrieve from the current ResultSet, otherwise false.

      • nextChunk

        public java.util.Vector<T> nextChunk(int maxRow)
                                                 throws SearchException
        Retrieves the next maxRow IGeoObjects from the ResultSet.

        NOTE: Since a retrieved row can be a false candidate the real number of returned IGeoObjects can be less than max. False candidates are filtered out.
        Parameters:
        maxRow - maximum number of rows to retrieve
        Returns:
        Vector of IGeoObjects
        Throws:
        SearchException

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
            throws SearchException
        Aborts a query that is already being executed (may not be supported by the JDBC driver). Note: Call close() afterwards.
        Throws:
        SearchException

      • close

        public void close()
        When another Thread calls cancel() it may happen that the Connection remains open. This method is for explicitly freeing resources when a search is canceled.
